name: Sarah E. Frost
content: Sarah Frost, Ph.D - Computer Science Skip to main content Computer Science People Faculty Sarah Frost, Ph.D Sarah Frost, Ph.D Sarah Frost Clinical Assistant Professor CCP 253 Call: (208) 426-5766 sarahfrost@boisestate.edu About Me Bio Education Dr. Sarah Frost is a clinical assistant professor at Boise State.  She received her PhD in Computer Science and Engineering in 2009 from the University of Notre Dame where she studied the theory of reversible computation with an eye toward designing computer architectures that will take advantage of the speed, density, and low-power potential of emerging nanoscale devices.  She loves asking “what if?” questions and understanding what assumptions we are making – and what happens when those assumptions no longer hold true.  How does that effect computation? What new opportunities open up? Ph.D. (2009) in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Notre Dame. M.S. (2005) in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Notre Dame. B.A. (2001) in Computer Science and Philosophy from Hanover College Computer Science computerscience@boisestate.edu (208) 426-5766 City Center Plaza (CCP), RM 364 Back To Top
